info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:57PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Texas and northwestern Hansford Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Goodwell, or 14 miles south of Guymon, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Guymon and Goodwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
